alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:56PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Paulding, southwestern Cherokee, northwestern Cobb, eastern Polk and southern Bartow Counties through 345 PM EST... At 256 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Kingston to near Felton, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Cartersville, Dallas, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Holly Springs, Rockmart, Euharlee, Hiram, Emerson, Aragon, Kingston, Braswell, Taylorsville, Cassville, Buffington, Yorkville, Burnt Hickory Ridge and Kellogg Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
